description: This file defines the RequestHandler class within the WPEFramework::Plugin namespace. It declares methods for managing application lifecycle events such as launch, terminate, sendIntent, and updateState. It also provides accessors for associated component handlers like RuntimeManagerHandler, WindowManagerHandler, and IEventHandler. The class is designed as a singleton with private constructors and a static getInstance method. The file includes relevant external headers for dependencies and is primarily intended to facilitate lifecycle management of applications within the framework.

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.description: Manages application lifecycle events and provides access to component handlers within the plugin framework. Implements singleton pattern for global access.

methods.name: RequestHandler(const RequestHandler& obj)
methods.description: Deleted copy constructor to prevent copying of singleton instance.

methods.name: static RequestHandler* getInstance()
methods.description: Returns the singleton instance of RequestHandler.

methods.name: bool initialize(PluginHost::IShell* service, IEventHandler* eventHandler)
methods.description: Initializes the handler with service context and event handler.

methods.name: bool launch(ApplicationContext* context, const string& launchIntent, const Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Launches an application with given context and intent.

methods.name: bool terminate(ApplicationContext* context, bool force, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Terminates the specified application context, with option to force.

methods.name: bool sendIntent(ApplicationContext* context, const string& intent, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Sends an intent to the application context.

methods.name: bool updateState(ApplicationContext* context, Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Updates the lifecycle state of the application.

methods.name: RuntimeManagerHandler* getRuntimeManagerHandler()
methods.description: Provides access to the RuntimeManagerHandler component.

methods.name: WindowManagerHandler* getWindowManagerHandler()
methods.description: Provides access to the WindowManagerHandler component.

methods.name: IEventHandler* getEventHandler()
methods.description: Provides access to the event handler.
